question:
Find the complete solution of the following system of the differential equations:

$\begin{cases}
x'(t) = \frac{3}{2}x(t)-y(t)-\frac{1}{2}z(t) \\
y'(t) = -\frac{1}{2}x(t)+2y(t)+\frac{1}{2}z(t) \\
z'(t) = \frac{1}{2}x(t)+y(t)+\frac{5}{2}z(t)
\end{cases}$

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&5x &- &10y &+ &10z &= &8 \\
&-x &+ &2y &+ &z &= &-2 \\
&x &- &2y &+ &2z &= &-3
\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.

question: Customers are used to evaluate preliminary product designs. In the past, $95\%$ of highly successful products received good reviews, $60\%$ of moderately successful products received good reviews, and $10\%$ of poor products received good reviews. In addition, $40\%$ of products have been highly successful, $35\%$ have been moderately successful, and $25\%$ have been poor products. If a roduct does not attain a good review, what is the probability that it will be a highly successful product?

The significance level for a hypothesis test is $0.05$. Choose the correct interpretation.
answer1: The probability to make a Type $I$ error is $0.05$.
answer2: The probability of making a Type $II$ error is $0.95$.
answer3: The probability that the sample is randomly selected is $0.05$.
answer4: The probability, that the null hypothesis will be rejected is $0.05$.

answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question:
Consider the linear transformation $F: \mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ be defined by $F(x, y)=(x+3y, 2x-y, x)$. 
Let the kernel, $ker(F)$ and the space image of $F$, $range(F)$, respectively.  Choose the right answer:

Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

Ralph Edmund loves steaks and potatoes. Therefore, he has decided to go on a steady diet of only these two foods (plus some liquids and vitamin supplements) for all his meals. Ralph realizes that this isn't the healthiest diet, so he wants to make sure that he eats the right quantities of the two foods to satisfy some key nutritional requirements. He has obtained the following nutritional and cost information:

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|c|c|}
\hline
%& \multicolumn{2}{c|}{Grams of ingredient per serving} &\\
\text{Ingredient} & \text{Steak (gr. per serving)} & \text{Potatoes (gr. per serving)} & \text{Daily Requirements (gr.)} \\
\hline
\text{Carbohydrates} & 5 & 15 & \geq 50 \\
\text{Protein} & 20 & 5 & \geq 40 \\
\text{Fat} & 15 & 2 & \leq 60 \\
\hline
\text{Cost per serving} & 4 & 2 &  \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
	
Use a computer (Solver Add-in in Excel) to solve this model by the simplex method to allow planning the Ralph's diet, considering that $x_{i}$ is the number of daily servings of food $i$ ($i=1$, for steak and $i=2$, for potatoes).

The WorldLight Company produces two light fixtures (products $1$ and $2$) that require both metal frame parts and electrical components. Management wants to determine how many units of each product to produce so as to maximize profit. For each unit of product $1$, $1$ unit of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. For each unit of product $2$, $3$ units of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. The company has $200$ units of frame parts and $300$ units of electrical components. 

Each unit of product $1$ gives a profit of $1?$, and each unit of product $2$, up to $60$ units, gives a profit of $2?$. Any excess over	$60$ units of product $2$ brings no profit, so such excess has been ruled out.

How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized to allow planning of the company's activity?
answer1:
\[
\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Maximize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
		\text{subject to} & x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
	        & 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			& x_{2}\leq 60\\
			&  x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Minimize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
			    & 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			    & x_{2}\leq 60\\
			    & x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Maximize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} &  x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
    			& 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			    & x_{2}\geq 60\\
			    & x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]

question: Consider the subspace $S$ of the upper triangular matrices of order $2$ whose trace is null. A base of the vector space S is:

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

A base of $S$ is the set:

For every $m\in\mathbb{R}$, consider the line $r$ of equation $x+my=-3$ and the line $s$ of equation $mx+4y=6$.
Describe the mutual position of $r$ and $s$ with respect to the value of $m$.
answer1: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=-2$, parallel if $m=2$, and secant otherwise.
answer2: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=2$, parallel if $m=-2$, and secant otherwise.
answer3: The lines $r$ and $s$ are secant for every $m$.
answer4: The lines $r$ and $s$ are parallel for every $m$.

question: Differentiate $y = \operatorname{ln}{(2t + 1)}$.

$x^4-10=6$

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question:
Solve the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Choose the set of vectors which is not a spanning set of $\mathbb{R}^2$.
You placed 3 white balls and 5 black balls in a bag. If a ball is drawn from the bag at random, what is the probability it is black?

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 2 \\ 
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\ 
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $(5,3,3)$ as unique solution.
answer3: The system has $(10,5,6)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The system has $(\frac{5}{3}z,1+\frac{2}{3}z,z)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&5x &- &10y &+ &10z &= &8 \\
&-x &+ &2y &+ &z &= &-2 \\
&x &- &2y &+ &2z &= &-3
\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.

question: $G$ is a non trivial connected simple graph. Which is the true sentence?
answer1: If $|V(G)|\geq 2$ there is a connected induced subgraph.
answer2: All induced subgraphs of $G$ are connected.
answer4: There is a non-trivial proper induced subgraph that is also connected.

Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

represents the graph:
Let $z\in\mathbb{C}$ be a complex number. Then we always have:

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
3x & - & y & - & 2z & = & a \\
-x & + & 3y & - & z & = & b \\
-2x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions if $a \neq 1$ and $b \neq -1$.
If $a=1$ and $b=-1$, then the system has $\left(\frac{2+7z}{8},\,\frac{-2+5z}{8},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,1,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4:
The system has no solution if $a\neq 1$ and $b\neq 1$. 
If $a=b=1$, the system has $\left(1+y,\,y,\,\frac{3+y}{4}\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
